snippet: A proposal for $109 billion in new transportation spending easily cleared a crucial hurdle on Thursday when the Senate voted 85 to 11 to allow it to proceed to debate.
abstract: Bipartisan proposal for the federal government to spend $109 billion over two years to upgrade roads, bridges and transit systems and create jobs easily clears a crucial hurdle as the Senate votes 85 to 11 to allow it to proceed to debate
lead_paragraph: A proposal for $109 billion in new transportation spending easily cleared a crucial hurdle on Thursday when the Senate voted 85 to 11 to allow it to proceed to debate.

headline.seo: Transportation Proposal Clears a Hurdle In the Senate
headline.main: Transportation Proposal Clears a Hurdle in the Senate
headline.print_headline: Transportation Proposal Clears a Hurdle In the Senate
